Sequence Information.Peptide Name: M21F (thanatin analog, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a, XXA; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.24%) tothanatinK=R: 14%, I=L=G=P: 10%.Activity: active against E. coli BL21 (MIC 0.5 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 0.5 uM), S. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 0.5 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (0.5 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 0.5 uM),  B. subtilis (MIC 1 uM), S. pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC <0.25 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC <0.25 uM).Structure:  2D NMR was used to determine the structure of the M21F variant and found a structure similar to the WT solved previously (see AP102).
Literature Information.Author: Sinha S, Dhanabal VB, Sperandeo P, Polissi A, Bhattacharjya S. 2022
Literature Information.Reference: Biochim Biophys Acta Biomembr. 2022 Mar 1;1864(3):183839. doi: 10.1016/j.bbamem.2021.183839.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Linking dual mode of action of host defense antimicrobial peptide thanatin: Structures, lipopolysaccharide and LptAm binding of designed analogs.
